intro: Bartsia fiebrigii, commonly known as the mountain bartsia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its flowers are small and clustered in whorls, often displaying a pale yellow to greenish color. Bartsia fiebrigii is characterized by its erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
